summary: I had a great time seeing the boys again. Interactive Introverts made realize that while I am considered a dinosaur among this...
body:
I had a great time seeing the boys again. Interactive Introverts made realize that while I am considered a dinosaur among this new ~phandom~ I know I still belong. I found myself, while in line, becoming fiercely protective of this community. Were there obnoxious kids at the show last night? Absolutely. Where bystanders making fun of them? Yes. Was I ready to tell the next LA hipster native to shut up and just let teenagers live? Yes.

There was a lot of screaming, but I remember being 19 years old and being the same way. I remember being 21 and being the same way. And that’s fine. Being excited and happy about something is perfectly fine.

ii really nailed the whole “be urself” topic. Phandom embrace your eccentricities, you’re not boring and don’t let others try and tell you to be.

summary: isn’t it funny how phannies as one say that ‘demon’ part of the phandom isn’t big, they’re just very toxic and invasive and...
body:
isn’t it funny how phannies as one say that ‘demon’ part of the phandom isn’t big, they’re just very toxic and invasive and blame all the drama times that phandom got/gets through, and then clarify they’re not anything like that, in fact, they respect dnp and their privacy


isn’t it funny how everyday i scroll the main tumblr tag and everything i see apart from art/updates is speculation, overanalyzing, and nasty half-imagine posts where people admittedly call themselves demons and express fairly weird unrealistic expectations, and the icing on that cake is a whole blog openning a whole discussion on ‘your favourite demon moments’ - and all that is on the tag
/hears people whining about dnp not making any more ‘tumblr tag’ videos/ smh


y’all need to:


  1. realise that whatever your wild dreams and fantasies are, projecting these on their relationship - whatever it is - is simply irrational. imagines are in no way a bad thing, but seeing people not just expressing thoughts, but actually stating and taking them as known facts (not to mention a strong part of them tend to be inappropriate - this info is not your business at all) is just wrong in many ways. go figure
  2. google the definition of ‘respect’ -  politeness, honour, and care shown towards someone or something that is considered important. from what i’ve been told, making everything they do or say into something about your ship and throwing it in their faces when they’ve stated they’re friends and clearly want to be treated as such isn’t showing respect.
    and taking the fact that dan once said that they’re not against shipping as an excuse to be ‘demon’ is a dull thing to do - do you think anyone’s gonna be approving of an enormous amount of people being up their asses to ‘prove’ whatever they think is going on between them?

reblog.comment:
isn’t it funny how phannies as one say that ‘demon’ part of the phandom isn’t big, they’re just very toxic and invasive and blame all the drama times that phandom got/gets through, and then clarify they’re not anything like that, in fact, they respect dnp and their privacy
